moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 h6: This looks like a mistake. I will sometimes with Black play Ba6 but only after a5 to give the Bishop some protection from the Rook.
moves.9. a3 Qb6 10. Be3 c5 11. Nf5: The best place for the Knight, a nice outpost
moves.11... Nbd7 12. Re1 Ne5 13. Be2 Rd8 14. b: Qxe4 would lose the vulnerable a6 Bishop.
moves.18... Nxe4 19. Bf3: The e4 Knight is now pinned twice
moves.23... Bxb4 24. Bc5: Possibly an inaccuracy - Rxa7 may have been better although White is going to win more material.
Gets the Rook off a Black square
moves.27... g6 28. Ne3 Kb7 29. Ra1 a5 30. Rd7+: I decide that taking off Black's remaining pieces should win quickly
moves.33... Rxb6 34. Nxb6 Kxb6 35. Kf1: The a and b pawns still have dangerous promotion potential so accurate play is essential
moves.35... Ka5 36. Ke2 b4 37. Kd3 f5 38. h4 g: Ten careful moves later and it is all over
